Class Documentation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Documentation

  • public class Documentation
extends java.lang.Object

    Sunrise Framework provides overridable controllers, a plugin architecture and default components to speed up the web shop development.

    Overridable Controllers

    request scoped, implicitly for others
    • SunriseHomeController
    • SunriseProductDetailController
    • SunriseProductOverviewController

    Controller Components

    ControllerComponents are plugins for controllers which communicate with the controller on the one hand via dependency-injected fields like UserContext and on the other hand via Hooks of the controller. A controller component instance lives in the RequestScope so they assist with one HTTP request and then for the next HTTP request another instance is created. Controller components implement the hooks of the controllers where they need to do sth. for example implementing PageDataHook enables to change the content that will be rendered, the hook is called when all asynchronous requests are completed. The hook RequestHook enables to do sth. when a request comes in like log stuff, call external systems. The hook ProductProjectionSearchFilterHook enables to modify a search request for example to add extension paths. For a good explanation how such a component works look into the source code of ProductSuggestionsControllerComponent.

    Tags

    Tags can be used as facility to check if a multi-controller-component should be used for a controller.

    The tags for a controller are documented in the Sunrise Framework controller class.

    Normally a controller contains a tag for the module, like "product-catalog", which it belongs to.

    Tags should match the regular expression [a-z][-a-z0-9]+, so they don't contain uppercase letters and words are separated by a dash. They do not contain "page" or "controller" and they should not be accronyms like "pdp" for "product-detail-page".
